full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 536 Filed 12/10/21 Page 42 of 43 42 LBNAMAXTps

1 Protection Act and 615. Why don't you both look at it, confer,
2 see if you can come to agreement, and if not, put in a letter.
3 MS. COMEY: Thank you, your Honor.
4 THE COURT: Thank you.
5 MR. PAGLIUCA: Your Honor, one other issue on sequestration. I was hoping to be able to provide a copy of
6 Dr. Rocchio's testimony to either Dr. Dietz or Dr. Loftus, because I anticipate there may be issues that come up that they
7 need to address during their testimony. And so for that purpose I would ask for a limited exclusion from Rule 615 for
8 those witnesses.
9 MR. ROHRBACH: That's fine with the government, your Honor.
10 THE COURT: Thank you. This is why I asked. Make sure we're on the same page.
11 Anything else in that regard?
12 MS. COMEY: Not from the government, your Honor.
13 THE COURT: When may I have an order-of-witness list?
14 MS. COMEY: We would propose by Saturday, your Honor?
15 THE COURT: OK. And, as I always do, I ask at the final pretrial conference if any plea offers were communicated
16 to the defense.
17 MS. COMEY: None were communicated, your Honor.
18 THE COURT: And Ms. Sternheim, that's accurate; none were communicated?

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00008352
